text: hello everyone I'm nirb Agarwal I'm on

design and build the latest generative
AI features from AWS that you use within
your
organizations in this brief demo video
we will look at a key responsible AI
capability available with the Amazon
Titan image generator models called
Watermark
detection but before we dive into
Watermark detection let's quickly review
the Amazon Titan image generator models
available with Amazon
Bedrock Amazon Titan image generator
model is a foundation model trained on
large data sets to enable content
creators to quickly ideate and iterate
by generating high quality
images this model can generate realistic
studio quality images in large volumes
and at a low cost using natural language
and the model is highly customizable
with proprietary data to produce images
consistent with your brand style if you
haven't tried out this new model yet I
highly encourage you to do so within the
Amazon Bedrock
console now as content creators create
realistic looking images with AI it's
important to promote responsible
development of this technology and
reduce the spread of
misinformation that's why all images
generated with Amazon Titan image
generator model contain an invisible
Watermark by
default Watermark detection is an
Innovative technology and AWS is among
the first major Cloud providers
to widely release buil-in watermarks for
AI image
outputs now this discrete mechanism
allows you to identify Titan generated
images and these watermarks are designed
to be temper resistant helping increase
transparency around AI generated content
as these capabilities continue to
advance with that let's Jump Right In
the demo and first we will generate an
image using Amazon Titan image generator
model in the Amazon bedro
console so here we are in the Amazon
Bedrock console from the top left I can
access the side navigation where I can
access all of the capabilities and
different features available in Amazon
Bedrock for example getting started
Pages different models that are
available different
playgrounds uh so for our uh demo let's
focus on image
playground so here we are in the image
playground the first thing we have to do
is to select a model so I click on
select model and I select Titan image
generator G1 model and hit apply so now
the model is loaded in this playground
and on the right we see all of the
configurations that are supported by
this model and on the left is where all
the images will be generated so now
let's type in a prompt to generate

want to generate images of a che in
African desert so I type in the prompt

was downloaded
in my computer so to test this image now
for watermark detection we now go back
to our side navigation and go to the
page called Watermark detection under
the save cards
section click on it so this is the
watermark detection page there are two
sections here first section is where we
upload the image which we want to test
for watermark and then the second
section is the result section where once
the image has been analyzed by the model
to detect for watermark the results will
be published here so let's take our
image that we recently generated right
uh so I click on choose image I select
the image that was
generated open so now we see the image
has been loaded here as shown in the
thumbnail and all I have to do is Click
analyze to start analyzing it for
watermark as we can see the model
quickly analyze that image and it
detected a watermark which it's supposed
to so it says watermark detected with a
high confidence score what confidence
score represents is a confidence in
Watermark detection in some cases the
detection confidence score might be low
for example if you have generated an
image from the model and then you edited
it in an image editing software so in
those cases the confidence score might
be low but here we have a high
confidence score because we did not edit
that image at all now let's try a flip
case I have a photograph of aita uh
which was not ated by any of the image
models uh and let's try that image
whether the watermark is there or not so
I uploaded that other image and I click
analyze and the model is analyzing and
then as you can see the watermark was
not detected on this image because it
was not generated by the
model we hope that this demo sparked
some ideas of how you can use Amazon
Titan image generator to produce high
quality realistic images or enhance
existing images by simply using natural
language prompts all Amazon Titan
Foundation models are built with
responsible AI in Mind by detecting and
removing harmful content from their data
rejecting inappropriate user inputs and
filtering model outputs and as we
showcased in this demo all Amazon Titan
generated images contain an invisible
Watermark by default designed to help
reduce the spread of misinformation by
providing a discrete mechanism to
identify a generated images I hope you
